flounder.physics.shapes

Class Ray

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.physics.Ray

  • public class Ray
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds a 3 dimensional ray.

    • Constructor Summary

      Ray(boolean useMouse, Vector2f screenStart)
      Creates a new 3D ray.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ray

        public Ray(boolean useMouse,
           Vector2f screenStart)
        Creates a new 3D ray.
        Parameters:
        useMouse - If the ray will use the mouse coords or to start from screenStart.
        screenStart - If useMouse is false then this will be used as the rays start.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(Vector3f currentPosition)
        Updates the ray to a new position.
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - The new position.

      • getOrigin

        public Vector3f getOrigin()
        Gets the rays origin.
        Returns:
        The rays origin.

      • getCurrentRay

        public Vector3f getCurrentRay()
        Gets the current ray.
        Returns:
        The current ray.

      • getPointOnRay

        public Vector3f getPointOnRay(float distance,
                              Vector3f destination)
        Gets a point on the ray.
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance down the ray to sample.
        destination - The destination vector, if null one will be created.
        Returns:
        Returns the destination vector.

      • convertToScreenSpace

        public Vector3f convertToScreenSpace(Vector3f position,
                                     Vector3f destination)
        Converts a position from world space to screen space.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to convert.
        destination - The destination point. X and Y being screen space coords and Z being the distance to the camera.
        Returns:
        Returns the destination vector.

        public java.lang.String toString()
